title: How to Make Mini Fruit Pizzas on Sugar Cookies

steps.headline: Assemble everything to make cooking efficient.
steps.description: Get out a mixing bowl, a mixer, a large mixing spoon, all the ingredients listed under Sugar Cookies ingredients, a little extra flour, a rolling pin, and a cookie cutter.

steps.headline: Put the shortening and sugar together in bowl.
steps.description: Mix until it forms a creamy consistency.

steps.headline: Once creamy, add eggs one at a time continuing to beat.
Add sour cream and vanilla and blend a few more seconds until mixture is smooth.
In a small mixing bowl, sift baking soda, baking powder, flour, and salt with a spoon.
steps.description: Add to the cream mixture. Use a spoon to mix until all the dry ingredients are completely blended. Mix as little as necessary once the baking powder and soda have been put in. Just do it enough to ensure there are no lumps and then stop.

steps.headline: Use a rolling pin to roll dough on floured surface until about 1/4-1/2” thick.

steps.headline: Use a small mixing bowl to make the cream cheese frosting.
Whip together topping and cream cheese in mixing bowl.
steps.description: Once the combination is smooth and creamy, add in the sugar. For a smoother more whipped consistency, use a mixer whipping attachment or whisk rather than the blending attachment used for the sugar cookies.

parts.name: Assembling the Mini Fruit Pizza Cookies

steps.headline: Put the cream cheese frosting in the fridge until the cookies cool.
Cut up whatever fresh fruit is desired.
steps.description: Place the chopped fruit in the fridge until it is ready to use. Leave some fruit uncut such as blueberries and cut others such as strawberries or kiwi. Choose fruits of different shapes and sizes to create a more pleasing appearance.

steps.headline: Once the cookies have cooled, take the cream cheese frosting and fruit from the fridge.
steps.description: Cover the cookies with a thick layer of cream cheese frosting, and put fruit on top as desired. Lightly push the fruit into the cream cheese frosting so that it will stay when the mini fruit pizza cookies are moved.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Keep the mini fruit pizza cookies covered and refrigerated until ready to serve.

text: Making the Sugar Cookies Assemble everything to make cooking efficient. Get out a mixing bowl, a mixer, a large mixing spoon, all the ingredients listed under Sugar Cookies ingredients, a little extra flour, a rolling pin, and a cookie cutter. Put the shortening and sugar together in bowl. Mix until it forms a creamy consistency. Once creamy, add eggs one at a time continuing to beat. Beat for two minutes. Add sour cream and vanilla and blend a few more seconds until mixture is smooth.  In a small mixing bowl, sift baking soda, baking powder, flour, and salt with a spoon. Add to the cream mixture. Use a spoon to mix until all the dry ingredients are completely blended. Mix as little as necessary once the baking powder and soda have been put in. Just do it enough to ensure there are no lumps and then stop. Use a rolling pin to roll dough on floured surface until about 1/4-1/2” thick. Use cookie cutter to cut dough. Place on cookie sheet. Bake at 350ºF/180ºC for 10-12 minutes. Making the cream cheese frosting Use a small mixing bowl to make the cream cheese frosting.  Whip together topping and cream cheese in mixing bowl. Once the combination is smooth and creamy, add in the sugar. For a smoother more whipped consistency, use a mixer whipping attachment or whisk rather than the blending attachment used for the sugar cookies. Assembling the Mini Fruit Pizza Cookies Put the cream cheese frosting in the fridge until the cookies cool.  Cut up whatever fresh fruit is desired. Place the chopped fruit in the fridge until it is ready to use. Leave some fruit uncut such as blueberries and cut others such as strawberries or kiwi. Choose fruits of different shapes and sizes to create a more pleasing appearance. Once the cookies have cooled, take the cream cheese frosting and fruit from the fridge. Cover the cookies with a thick layer of cream cheese frosting, and put fruit on top as desired. Lightly push the fruit into the cream cheese frosting so that it will stay when the mini fruit pizza cookies are moved. Serve. Keep the mini fruit pizza cookies covered and refrigerated until ready to serve.
